intro: Inga purpusii, commonly known as the purple inga, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, purple-pink flowers. The plant is known for its rapid growth and is often found in moist, shaded forest understories. Its pods contain seeds that are dispersed by animals, contributing to its ecological role in forest regeneration. The plant also has a symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria, enhancing soil fertility.
